oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A guide to organic grassland
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Philipps, Lois
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
Pasture and forage crops
Education, extension and communication
Feeding and growth
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Organic farming systems in the UK are traditionally based on ley/arable crop rotations. Up to 70% of the farmed area comprises of mixed grass and legume leys. These leys offer a powerful mechanism for supplying nitrogen through their potential to harvest biologically fixed nitrogen to support both animal production and a subsequent phase of arable cropping. This bulletin answers some of the common questions about organic grassland management.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Philipps, Lois (2001) A guide to organic grassland. Elm Farm Research Centre Bulletin (56), pp. 9-10.
